benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered: Valid requests and happy paths: TC01, TC18, TC05 cover successful retrieval with and without query parameters, returning 200 and a JSON array
Query parameter handling: includedDeleted (true/false), audit=FULL/MINIMAL, combined parameters and an unsupported audit case are exercised (TC02-TC05, TC09, TC10, TC17)
Path parameter validation and error codes: invalid UUID => 400 (TC08) and bundle not found => 404 (TC07)
Authorization negative cases: missing and invalid auth tokens => 401 (TC12, TC13)
Empty response behavior: no-tags case returns an empty JSON array (TC06)
Content type and response format: application/json asserted in the happy path (TC01)
Security/input validation: injection/malicious payload handling tested (TC14)
Resilience and non-functional tests: API unavailable (TC11), slow dependency simulation (TC16), very large dataset (TC15), concurrency and performance tests (TC19, TC20)
Regression checks: deleted tags excluded when includedDeleted=false and included when true (TC02, TC17)
gaps: Pagination: no tests for pagination (page/offset/limit) or behavior when results are split across pages
Caching behavior: no tests for ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, or 304 responses
Rate limiting/throttling: no tests to exercise or validate 429 responses and Retry-After semantics
Schema and content validation: Tag object fields, types, required properties and the audit object structure are not asserted against the Tag definition
Authorization nuance: no tests for 403 Forbidden or authenticated users with insufficient permissions/roles
Query parameter validation gaps: includedDeleted invalid/non-boolean values and explicit audit=NONE case are not covered
Server error scenarios: explicit 500 Internal Server Error and standardized error payload format are not tested
Content negotiation: Accept header behavior and non-JSON Accept values are not tested
Data correctness/isolation: no test asserts that returned tags belong only to the requested bundle (no cross-bundle leakage)
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify offset/limit/page parameters, boundary values, ordering stability, and correctness when iterating through large result sets
Add caching tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match to receive 304, and verify repeated-request caching semantics
Add rate limit tests: generate bursts/sustained traffic to trigger 429 responses, validate Retry-After header and client behavior under throttling
Add schema validation: validate Tag model fields (ids, names, categories), data types, required properties and audit subfields for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE
Add access control tests: verify 403 Forbidden for valid credentials without required permissions and test role-based access scenarios if applicable
Add query parameter validation tests: includedDeleted=invalid (e.g., "abc"), explicit audit=NONE, and case-sensitivity checks; assert consistent 400/422 responses
Add server error simulations: force DB/cache failures to validate 500 responses and ensure error payload conforms to a standard error schema
Assert Content-Type and caching headers consistently across all successful responses (not just TC01)
Add data integrity tests: ensure tags returned belong only to the requested bundle and add tests for concurrent modifications (read while delete/add) to detect race conditions
Refine performance tests: formalize SLAs (p95/p99 latencies), run CI-friendly load tests with defined thresholds, and capture resource metrics (CPU, memory) during tests
